comment: First local whiskey I've liked. Could be superb if left in the barrel for 2 more years.
Very smooth. No bite til 20-30 seconds after, even then minimal. With the ingredients being different than normal had a different after taste. Unique but thoroughly enjoyable.
Starts off sweet, then comes with a slight spice. Finishes with a strong caramel.
Fantastic. Nice rich, well rounded flavor. I love the way the caramel works its way in.
Sharp and spicy on the first sip, finishes with a distinct oak aftertaste. Almost like a campfire.
For a relatively young bourbon it sips extremely smoothly!
Meh.  Definitely needs water.  Tough after taste.  Lots of caramel.
Got this at the PX in Ft Knox. Felt like I was committing a sin purchasing this in actual bourbon country. Sweet and smooth.
